articles.author: Mihir Zaveri
articles.title: Edward Aschoff, ESPN College Football Reporter, Dies at 34
articles.description: Mr. Aschoff had contracted pneumonia, according to his social media posts, and died after a “brief illness,” the network reported.
articles.content: Mr. Aschoff grew up in Oxford, Miss. His parents were both educators, and he played soccer and baseball, according to his biography with the Football Writers Association of America. In middle school, Mr. Aschoff was inspired to become a sports journalist by t… [+827 chars]

articles.author: Katharine Q. Seelye
articles.title: Joseph Segel, Founder of the QVC Shopping Network, Dies at 88
articles.description: The chief executive of QVC’s parent company said it “changed the way the world shops.” Mr. Segel’s many other ventures included the Franklin Mint.
articles.content:
He had an innate feel for what consumers wanted and for how to sell it to them. 
In 1964, he observed two disparate events: national mourning for Gen. Douglas MacArthur, who led the Allied victory over Japan in World War II, and a run on banks to buy silver … [+1529 chars]

articles.author: Roslyn Sulcas
articles.title: Not Just Propaganda: A New View of Soviet Artists
articles.description: An exhibition in St. Petersburg, Russia, takes a fresh look at two painters whose works were once dismissed as instruments of state control.
articles.content:
ST. PETERSBURG, Russia Figures stare boldly from the canvas, exuding youth and health. Athletes conquer their opponents, factory workers strive proudly for excellence, and soldiers stride off to war, confident of victory.

articles.author: Michael Gold
articles.title: Her Children Found Her Body. Now a Parolee Is Accused of Murder.
articles.description: Luz Perez, whose 5-year-old son and 2-year-old daughter found her dead on her bedroom floor, was strangled, officials said.
articles.content:
A 5-year-old boy was at the window of his Bronx apartment, screaming frantically for help. He and his 2-year-old sister had been alone in the apartment for hours after finding their mother lifeless on the bedroom floor.
A passer-by answered the boys panicked… [+618 chars]

articles.description: For some Democrats, a key part of the former vice president’s pitch is that their moderate friends and relatives like him, too.

Doral, about seven miles from Miami International Airport, reflects the challenges the hotel business has faced, with even Mr. Trump acknowledging that his politics have driven away certain customers.
